JobFullDesc: Help us build an inclusive Microsoft web! Web Experience Collective (WXC) is a design and research team working on the forefront of new experiences for our customers in search, maps, advertising, and news. We collaborate in a customer-driven environment where our decisions are grounded in responsible design, creating experiences that make the web a better place for every person and organization on the planet to achieve more. If you’re passionate about web, technology, driven to deeply understand customer needs and industry trend, and lead with a growth mindset, we want to hear from you. This is an opportunity to lead emerging consumer web experiences that will delight and engage with millions of customers across the globe.  In this role you will be embedded in Bing Design Systems team to lead research on identifying customer needs, customer behaviors and industry trends relating to search behaviors and web interactions, across mobile and desktop platforms. Your insights will directly inform design explorations and product decision-making to push our design system forward, and you will work closely with Designers, PMs and Engineers to translate your recommendations into real-world products that delight customers while delivering business success.  We’re seeking a highly motivated and engaged Design Researcher with proven experience to energize multidisciplinary teams with passion and energy, not afraid to take big bets and hone them through iteration and direct customer connection.  ResponsibilitiesManage and drive customer research on search behaviors of diverse age groups, cultures and scenarios to unlock new UX ideas and stimulate innovation  Understand and follow competitors and identify + synthesize industry trends and design trends worldwide Demonstrate fluency of design strategy and techniques to measure success, present opportunities, and support decision-making and prioritization utilizing qualitative and quantitative research methods Routinely evaluate and track experiences against key business metrics, throughout the product funnel and lifecycle Collaborate with the design lead and product team to ground design + tech innovations around target customers, their needs and behaviors, directly influencing design explorations and product implementations Work with agility in a structured and programmatic way that deeply integrates with design team members and PM/dev partners Bring customer obsession into product thinking, holding the team accountable for inclusive design and help create feedback loops with current and future customers Work across Microsoft products and organizations to create unified and aligned customer experiences  Qualifications3+ years as a UX researcher or equivalent role Intimate knowledge and passion for digital product making and how to generate hypothesis with design and engineering team and create experiments to learn and iterate on design solutions Experience with a wide range of UX research methodologies, using both remote and local methods Experience at synthesizing large scale and small scale data to drive for integrated insights Experience with online data analytics is desirable Experience researching diverse groups of people such as international audiences, multi-language localization, inclusive design and accessibility for people with challenges. Proven ability to combine secondary and primary research to tell compelling customer-based stories Excellent communication and storytelling skills influencing across disciplines MFA in Design or relevant experiences and/or MA/MS or PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Social Science or related fields Experience working in the UX design field is a plus A portfolio review will be required for all candidate interviews  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
